title: Job Openings at T.O.N Corporate Services
content:
T.O.N Corporate Services  - Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We’re seeking a high-performing Senior Sales Executive with a hunter mindset, individuals who thrive on identifying untapped opportunities, engaging new markets, building strong customer relationships and closing new business at speed.
	Your focus will be acquiring new clients across specific market segments by understanding the needs of the key personas and how we help simplify and solve their international payment requirements.
	This role is ideal for someone who is target-driven, isn’t fazed by pressure, and has deep experience in selling financial services or payment solutions to medium and large-scale businesses. Experience in cross-border trade or payments across Africa is a strong advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Own and execute a strategic new business acquisition approach: identifying, researching, and engaging high-potential prospects.
	Acquire new customers consistently every month from the import/export, freight forwarding, logistics, or trade aggregation space.
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly acquisition targets across customer sign-ups, onboarding and transactions.
	?Build strong relationships with key decision-makers (e.g., CFOs, procurement heads, logistics leads).
	Manage and well updated sales pipeline and deal tracking using CRM tools.
	Collaborate with product, operations, and compliance teams to support successful onboarding and activation.
	Provide market intelligence and feedback to inform commercial strategy, market messaging and product development.
	Participate in key trade events to drive new leads and support the development of the brand.


Requirements


	4-7 years of experience in B2B sales, ideally selling financial services, fintech, trade finance, or payment products.
	Proven success in winning new business and hitting client acquisition targets.
	Experience selling to importers/exporters, freight forwarders, aggregators, or trade-related businesses.
	Strong knowledge of international payments, FX flows, and African cross-border trade dynamics.
	Experience selling into other African countries (e.g., Ghana, Kenya, Ivory Coast) is preferred.
	Confident working independently in a fast-paced, target-led environment.
	Fluent in English. Fluency in French will be an added advantage.


Person Specifications:


	Relentlessly proactive and self-motivated.
	Comfortable with initiating new conversations and cultivating new relationships from scratch.
	Strong discovery, consultative selling, and closing skills.
	High activity levels (client engagement, outreach, follow-ups) and strong deal discipline.
	Organized with excellent pipeline and time management.
	Goal-oriented and motivated by performance-based metrics.
	Able to manage multiple sales cycles simultaneously.
	Physically based in Nigeria and able to travel.


Benefits


	Competitive base salary + uncapped commissions
	Sales incentive bonuses for hitting monthly/quarterly goals
	Travel allowance and flexible work setup where applicable
	Growth opportunities in a fast-scaling fintech across African markets
	Learning and development support
	Working with a truly global and supportive team that will work together to support you for success.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Sales Manager (FX)

Job Location: Lagos (Hybrid - office or client visits 2-3 times a week)
Job Type: Full Time

Role Overview


	This role involves taking full ownership of business growth, acquiring and managing high-value clients, and leading strategic sales efforts to expand reach in the market. You will be responsible for closing large deals, building deep client relationships, and driving significant revenue growth. 
	As a Sales Manager, you will also have the opportunity to shape the sales function by mentoring junior team members, setting performance standards, and helping to build a scalable, high-performing sales engine. You will collaborate closely with treasury, operations, and compliance teams to ensure seamless execution of client transactions and an exceptional customer experience. 
	This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys working independently, and has a proven track record of exceeding targets and leading business development efforts. 


Key Responsibilities 
Strategic Business Development:


	Identify and close opportunities with high-value clients and businesses (corporates, HNIs, aggregators).
	Build partnerships and strategic alliances to grow market reach.
	Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and key networking forums.


Revenue Growth & Target Achievement:


	Own and exceed monthly and quarterly revenue targets.
	Develop and refine sales strategies that maximize deal flow and conversion.
	Provide detailed sales forecasts, pipeline updates, and market intelligence to leadership.


Client Relationship Leadership:


	Serve as the escalation point for key client accounts, ensuring top-tier service delivery.
	Provide insights to product and operations teams on client needs to shape offerings.
	Anticipate market trends and proactively engage clients with timely solutions.


Team Leadership & Coaching (Where Applicable):


	Mentor and coach Sales Executives to improve their performance and achieve team goals.
	Collaborate with leadership to recruit, onboard, and develop new team members.
	Foster a culture of accountability, learning, and results within the sales team.


Requirements


	5+ years of experience in business development, relationship management, or enterprise sales, with at least 2 years handling senior-level clients or managing a portfolio of HNIs / corporations.
	Proven track record of exceeding sales targets and closing high-value, complex deals.
	Experience mentoring or leading sales teams (formal or informal leadership).
	Strong commercial acumen and ability to develop go-to-market strategies.
	Established network within the Nigerian financial ecosystem and B2B environment.
	Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work independently, make data-driven decisions, and drive measurable outcomes.





Benefits


	Senior role with direct influence on revenue strategy and client growth.
	Competitive compensation + performance incentives.
	Opportunity to shape and scale a sales team as the company grows.
	Hybrid remote setup with autonomy and flexibility.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Sales Executive (FX)

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Role Overview


	As a Sales Executive, you will be responsible for acquiring and onboarding clients who need cross-border payment solutions, building strong relationships, and managing the entire sales cycle from lead generation to transaction execution. 
	This is a highly entrepreneurial role where you will have the opportunity to build and manage your own book of business, collaborate with treasury and operations teams to deliver excellent client experience, and contribute to growth strategy in Nigeria and globally. 


Key Responsibilities
Business Development & Client Acquisition:


	Identify, prospect, and onboard new High-Net-Worth Individuals (HNIs) and businesses looking for cross-border payment solutions. 
	Develop and execute a lead generation strategy, including partnerships, referrals, and market outreach. 
	Build and maintain a healthy pipeline of potential clients. 


Relationship & Account Management:


	Serve as the primary point of contact for your clients. 
	Understand client needs and recommend solutions that deliver value. 
	Ensure seamless execution of transactions by collaborating with treasury and operations teams. 
	Deliver a premium client experience through proactive communication and problem resolution. 


Sales & Revenue Growth:


	Set and achieve monthly and quarterly business targets. 
	Keep clients informed about market trends and offerings to drive repeat transactions. 
	Track and report key sales metrics regularly.


Collaboration & Team Building:


	Work closely with internal teams (treasury, compliance, operations) to ensure smooth service delivery.
	Mentor junior team members and contribute to building out the sales


Requirements


	3 - 5 years of experience in business development, sales, or client relationship management. Preferably in fintech, banking, FX, or payments.
	Proven track record of acquiring and managing HNIs or corporate clients, with evidence of achieving or exceeding targets.
	Strong network of businesses, HNIs, and decision-makers.
	Deep understanding of financial products, FX, and cross-border transactions.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Entrepreneurial mindset, self-starter who can work independently and thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment. 


Click here to apply online

 

 

4.)Strategy Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type:  Full time

Job Description


	The Strategy Development Manager will be responsible for developing and executing strategies that drive growth, optimize operations, and strengthen the company’s competitive position in the FMCG sector.
	The role requires strong analytical skills, market knowledge, and the ability to translate insights into actionable business plans that improve efficiency, expand market share, and maximize profitability.


Key Responsibilities


	? Lead the development of corporate and business unit strategies to support long-term growth.
	Conduct market research, consumer behavior analysis, and competitor benchmarking to identify opportunities and risks.
	Work closely with sales, marketing, supply chain, and finance teams to align strategy with operational execution.
	Develop go-to-market strategies for new products and optimize existing product lines.
	Monitor performance of strategic initiatives and provide regular reports to management.
	Evaluate distribution channels and recommend improvements for market penetration and efficiency.
	Support the leadership team in identifying potential partnerships, joint ventures, and expansion opportunities.
	Prepare strategic presentations and business cases for management and stakeholders.
	Track FMCG industry trends, regulatory updates, and emerging best practices to ensure competitiveness.
	Recommend process improvements that enhance operational excellence and cost efficiency.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Management, or related field (MBA or Master’s degree preferred).
	5–7 years of experience in strategy development, corporate planning, or business consulting within the FMCG industry.
	Strong knowledge of FMCG markets, distribution networks, and consumer trends
	Proven track record of developing and implementing growth strategies in a fast-paced environment.
	Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills.
	Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, data analysis, and strategy tools.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic and commercial acumen
	Strong research and analytical capability
	Project management and execution
	Cross-functional collaboration
	Innovation and adaptability
	Results orientation.


Benefits


	Opportunity to grow in a dynamic FMCG company.
	Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives.
	A collaborative and innovative work environment.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.

title: Job Vacancies at Brands and Trade Limited
content:
Brands and Trade Limited is a unique distribution and logistics company in Lagos poised to disrupt the distribution landscape. We have a team of thinkers and doers, some of whom are supply chain and distribution experts who share a singular commitment to the job done. This includes our investors and directors who are not active in day-to-day operations.

Brands and Trade has a track record of achievements, successes and capacity enhancement in retail distribution thereby opening opportunities for new partnerships and growth. We constantly invest in technology, building the right infrastructure, and deploying bespoke tools and applications for superior inventory management. This is in line with our commitment to delivering the highest standards of service to every customer.
     

            
    



Brands and Trade distributes many world-class brands and products across five categories: Wine and Spirits; Beverages (alcoholic and non-alcoholic); Hygiene, Home, and Personal Care; Oil, Cereals and Grains; and Animal and pet care. We are a benchmark distribution partner for many multi-billion-naira businesses in Nigeria including International Breweries (Ab-InBev), Monument Distillers, Grand Cereals and Oils Limited and 2Sure (Life Care Division of SevenUp Bottling Company Ltd).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Finance Officer

Job Location: Ajah / Abraham Adesanya, Lagos
Industry: FMCG

About the Role


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Account Officer to join our team in a fast-paced FMCG modern trade environment.
	The ideal candidate must have solid accounting experience and be proficient in using QuickBooks (online) for daily financial operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day accounting operations including receivables, payables, and reconciliations.
	Maintain accurate financial records and ensure compliance with company policies.
	Prepare and analyze financial reports for management review.
	Monitor sales, collections, and inventory transactions in line with FMCG operations.
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning processes.
	Liaise with external auditors, banks, and tax authorities when required.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	1 - 5 years of proven experience as an Account Officer, preferably in an FMCG/modern trade environment.
	Strong knowledge of QuickBooks Online and MS Excel.
	Good knowledge of financial regulations and standards.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Exposure to a dynamic FMCG modern trade business.
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: herristoneresources@gmail.com using "Application – Finance Officer" as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Inventory Account Officer

Job Location: Ajah / Abraham Adesanya - Lagos
Reports To: Inventory Manager / Finance Manager
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Inventory Account Officer is responsible for managing and reconciling the financial aspects of inventory records.
	This includes ensuring that all inventory movements are accurately recorded and that stock balances remain consistent between the physical warehouse and the accounting system.
	The officer will work closely with warehouse, supply chain, sales, and finance teams to ensure seamless inventory flow, accurate reporting, and full compliance with company policy.
	The role also involves processing invoices, managing accounts payable/receivable, and maintaining accurate financial records.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Accounting & Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records of inventory transactions in the accounting system.
	Monitor and reconcile stock balances between physical count and ERP/manual records.
	Track inventory inflows and outflows (purchases, transfers, sales, returns, wastage).
	Prepare and submit periodic inventory reports (daily, weekly, monthly).
	Post journal entries for inventory adjustments, write-offs, and transfers.


Stock Control & Reconciliation


	Participate in physical stock counts and random spot checks.
	Reconcile stock variances between system and physical counts.
	Investigate and resolve discrepancies in coordination with relevant departments.
	Ensure accurate stock valuation based on FIFO, LIFO, or Weighted Average methods.


Internal Controls & Compliance:


	Ensure inventory transactions are properly documented (e.g., requisition forms, GRNs).
	Implement and enforce internal controls to prevent stock loss, theft, or misreporting.
	Maintain compliance with inventory policies and accounting standards.


Interdepartmental Coordination:


	Collaborate with warehouse and logistics teams to verify and document stock movement.
	Liaise with sales and operations teams to confirm product availability and resolve stock issues.


Audit & Documentation:


	Prepare inventory schedules and reports for internal and external audits.
	Support audit teams with required documentation and data.
	Maintain a well-organized archive of inventory and financial records.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of inventory records (physical vs. system).
	Timeliness and completeness of monthly reconciliations.
	Number of discrepancies identified and resolved.
	Readiness and accuracy of audit reports.
	Reduction in inventory losses and shrinkage.


Key Requirements


	Education: B.Sc. / HND in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Experience:** 0–4 years in inventory, accounting, or finance roles (preferably within FMCG).


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, etc.).
	Experience with ERP/inventory software (e.g., Online QuickBooks, SAP).
	Solid understanding of accounting principles related to inventory.


Soft Skills:


	Strong attention to detail and numerical accuracy.
	Analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and organization.
	Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: herristoneresources@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Supply Chain Officer

Job Location: Ajah / Abraham Adesanya, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Supply Chain
Reports To: Supply Chain Manager

Job Summary


	The Supply Chain Officer is responsible for managing and coordinating the end-to-end supply chain process, including procurement, and inventory management.
	The role ensures timely availability of goods and services, and compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and monitor the entire supply chain cycle of the warehouse.
	Develop and maintain strong supplier relationships to ensure continuous supply and minimize risks.
	Monitor inventory levels, track stock movements, and ensure optimal stock availability across the warehouse.
	Ensure compliance with internal procurement policies and external regulatory requirements.
	Prepare and analyze supply chain reports (stock status, supplier performance).
	Identify risks, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies in the supply chain and recommend improvement strategies.
	Support the implementation of supply chain management systems and best practices.
	Collaborate with finance, sales, operations, and other departments to align supply chain activities with organizational goals.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field.
	1 - 2 years of experience in supply chain, procurement.
	Strong knowledge of supply chain processes, procurement principles, and logistics management.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint); knowledge of ERP/Inventory software is an added advantage.
	Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Core Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and planning.
	Vendor and stakeholder management.
	Cost optimization and efficiency.
	Data-driven decision-making.
	Integrity and accountability.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: herristoneresources@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidates must reside in Ajah environs.

About the Role

	You will manage occurrences related to QR Group Staff and Customers on Ground, track trends and report any finding as required as well as overseeing the implementation of Qatar Airways OHS Manual and Policy across the Qatar Airways Group with the objective of making Qatar Airways Occupational Health and Safety Management System a success.


Specific Responsibilities for the Role 


	Liaise with QR Group outstation stakeholders to ensure compliance with the applicable national and/or state/regional OHS requirements.
	Participate in the recommendation of changes in policies, procedures and working practices, help monitor the review and revision of H&S policies & procedures to ensure continued compliance with all legal and other relevant requirements.
	Facilitate the implementation of the QR OHS Manual standards and procedures into Qatar Airways Group operations ensuring compliance with regulatory OHS requirements.
	Assist with staff and customer incidents’ related reports to ensure that the appropriate actions are taken to prevent reoccurrence.
	Ensure the effective development and implementation of campaigns within Qatar Airways to reduce incidents and injuries to Qatar Airways Group staff and passengers across the business.

Market Developer Job at Trustlub Fluid Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Trustlub Fluid Resources Limited is an indigenous company that engages in the production and distribution of Trustlub brand of lubricants, supply of fuels, associated lubrication engineering, importation of base oil, additives, grease and provision of customer support services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Market Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Market Developer is responsible for implementing and executing the marketing and sales strategies of the company.
	They are the first line of interface between the company and the customers.


Roles And Responsibilities


	To market and sell the company’s image and product to current, new and potential customers with a view to achieving set targets.
	To interface between the company and the customers for efficient service delivery.
	To achieve a monthly sales target and equivalent collections in litres.
	To prepare invoices and submit same to customers upon delivery of products.
	To organise and engage in marketing activities e.g. market storms, mechanic meets etc.
	To effectively cover and manage assigned territory.
	To submit accurate weekly sales performance reports.
	To prepare and submit monthly sales performance reports.

	B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in any field.
	3 - 5 years of cognate experience in the sales and marketing of Lubricants or FMCG products with strength in market storm, market activation, product canvassing.
	Ability to drive and in possession of a valid Nigerian driver`s license.
	Attention to detail.
	Target Oriented.
	Familiar with Lagos road networks.
